Method Detail

login

public Auth login(java.lang.String nick,
                  java.lang.String pw)
Logs in a user into the authentication system. This log in function does not allow administrators.

Parameters:
nick - is user's nick.
pw - is the user's password hashed with sha1.
Returns:
the authentication object or null if failed.

loginWP

public Auth loginWP(java.lang.String nick,
                    java.lang.String pw)
Logs in a user or an administrator into the authentication system.

Parameters:
nick - is user's or admin's nick.
pw - is the user's or admin's password hashed with sha1.
Returns:
the authentication object or null if failed.

getPositions

public Position[] getPositions(Auth a,
                               int id,
                               int c)
Gets the last n position of a user. The user must be administrator or friend of the target to have rights to get this.

Parameters:
a - the authentication object
id - the target user's id
c - the n count of positions
Returns:
the array of positions

setNote

public boolean setNote(Auth a,
                       Position position,
                       java.lang.String note,
                       java.lang.String photo)
This method creates a new note in the system. This note can have a photo, or be null.

Parameters:
a - the authentication object
position - the position object containing the latitude and longitude
note - the text of the note
photo - the photo if there is one, otherwise null
Returns:
whether the process succeed

getNotes

public Note[] getNotes(Auth a,
                       int id,
                       int c,
                       boolean attachPhotos)
This function returns the last n notes of an specific user. This notes can be requested with or with out photos.

Parameters:
a - the authentication object
id - the owner of the notes
c - the n count of notes
attachPhotos - whether you need the photos.
Returns:
the array of notes

getHash

private static java.lang.String getHash(java.lang.String message)
                                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
This function calculates the hash code of a String into another one. It uses the SHA1 algorithm. The code has been modified, but the original can be found at the url "http://es.debugmodeon.com/articulo/generar-hash-sha-1-de-una-cadena-en-java"

Parameters:
message - String to be hashed
Returns:
SHA1(message)
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
